Selected Answer: ACE
Save the report as a Snapshot (Option A): This option allows you to save the report's current data and layout as a snapshot. The snapshot can be viewed at a later time and will display the data as it was when the snapshot was created. Snapshots are useful for sharing a static version of the report's data without the need for real-time data updates.
Email the report (Option C): This option allows you to send the report's current data and layout as an email attachment or embedded in the email body. You can specify the recipients' email addresses, subject, and message. This is a common method to share dynamic reports with up-to-date data.
Save the report to an SFTP folder (Option E): This option enables you to save the report's current data as a file and store it in a designated folder on an SFTP (Secure File Transfer Protocol) server. This allows the manager to access and download the report from the specified location.
Options B (Text a link to the report) and D (Notify the manager with a pop-up) are not standard options available for delivering reports in Salesforce Marketing Cloud Reports.

The SQL Query Activity allows you to write SQL (Structured Query Language) queries to extract and combine data from different data extensions based on specified criteria. With SQL queries, you can perform joins, filter data, and create new data extensions containing the combined data.

In this case, the SQL Query Activity can be used to join the Shipping data extension and the Purchase data extension based on common fields (e.g., Order ID, Customer ID, or any other unique identifier) to retrieve the necessary information for the shipping notifications.

Option A (Filter Activity) is used to filter data within a data extension based on specific conditions, but it does not allow for joining data from different data extensions.

Option C (Group Refresh) is used to refresh a filtered or grouped data extension, and it does not perform data joins.

Option D (File Transfer Activity) is used to transfer files between Marketing Cloud and external systems, but it is not intended for joining data from different data extensions.
